intro: Coccocypselum glabrifolium, commonly known as the smooth-leaved coccocypselum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
